Generalized Association Analysis Across Data Sources

Source: R/run_association.R
run_association.Rd

Performs GLM-based association testing between an outcome and features from omics, exposures, latent factors, or GO-based PCs in a MultiAssayExperiment.

Usage

run_association(
  expomicset,
  outcome,
  source = c("omics", "exposures", "factors", "go_pcs"),
  covariates = NULL,
  feature_set = NULL,
  top_n = NULL,
  family = "gaussian",
  correction_method = "fdr",
  action = "add",
  min_genes = 10,
  feature_col = NULL,
  mirna_assays = NULL,
  print = NULL
)

Arguments

expomicset

A MultiAssayExperiment object.

outcome

A character string naming the outcome variable.

source

One of 'omics', 'exposures', 'factors', or 'go_pcs'.

covariates

Optional character vector of covariates.

feature_set

Optional vector of feature names (e.g., exposures, GO terms).

top_n

For omics: select top N variable features per assay.

family

GLM family ('gaussian' or 'binomial').

correction_method

Method for p-value adjustment. Default is 'fdr'.

action

Return results ('get') or attach to metadata ('add').

min_genes

Minimum genes per GO group (for GO PC source).

feature_col

Optional column to map GO terms to features.

mirna_assays

Assays to exclude in GO PC mode.

Value

If action = 'add', returns updated MultiAssayExperiment. Else returns result list.
